p: Ribavirin is a purine nucleoside analog with a broad-spectrum antiviral effect [ 28]. It is used mainly to treat respiratory syncytial virus infection [ 29] and in combination with interferon for hepatitis C [ 30]. Ribavirin was widely used in 2003 to treat SARS-CoV infection, but when used alone, it seemed to have no effect and caused significant hemolysis in many patients [ 31– 34]. When ribavirin was combined with IFN-β, it had good antiviral activity in in vitro studies [ 35]. Some studies have shown that in patients with severe MERS-CoV infection, ribavirin combined with IFN-α-2a treatment can significantly improve patient 14-day survival [ 36]. Preliminary in vitro test results demonstrate that ribavirin can inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in a human cell line. In the latest “Diagnosis and Treatment Protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia”, it is recommended to use ribavirin at a dose of 500 mg each time for adults and in combination with interferon or lopinavir/ritonavir, with 2–3 intravenous infusions daily. The course of treatment does not exceed 10 days [ 13].
